site.name: Ace Data Cloud
site.description: Ace Data Cloud is being built as an AI infrastructure platform for builders and teams who need reliable access, workflows, and monetization across modern AI systems.

overview.title: Ace Data Cloud 2026 Roadmap
paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud is being built as an AI infrastructure platform for builders and teams who need reliable access, workflows, and monetization across modern AI systems.

ace_token.title: $ACE Token
ace_token.subtitle: The ecosystem token powering Ace Data Cloud — verifiable, tradable, and community-driven.
paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud (ACE) is the ecosystem token of Ace Data Cloud. We are not changing the product — this section surfaces how ACE fits.
Users can always pay with USDC for convenience. Using ACE provides practical benefits across fees, limits, distribution, and earnings.
ace_token.how_used_subtitle: Clear, practical benefits for holders and power users.
how_used: Earnings from templates, apps, workflows, and referrals

founder.title: Founding Team
founder.subtitle: Ace Data Cloud comes from an experienced team dedicated to providing the highest quality services to customers.
founder.name: Germey
introductions: Founder of Ace Data Cloud, providing digital services globally.
With over 10 years of software development experience, GitHub Followers Global Ranking TOP 500.
Author of "Practical Python3 Web Scraping Development", recommended by Python's creator Guido, with global sales exceeding 150,000 copies.
With hundreds of open-source projects, participated in open-source projects with over 40,000 Stars, open-source image downloaded over 1,000,000 times.

recent_orders.subtitle: The latest 20 completed orders (IDs masked). Updated periodically by a scheduled job.

revenue.subtitle: Rolling totals from completed orders. Updated periodically by a scheduled job.

creator_fees.subtitle: Creator Fees earned on pump.fun. Updated periodically by a scheduled job.

capital_governance.title: ACE Revenue Allocation & Capital Governance
capital_governance.subtitle: Ace Data Cloud operates under a dual-track revenue governance model, with a strict and intentional separation between Creator Fees and Platform Revenue.

creator_fees.title: Creator Fees
creator_fees.description: Creator Fees are collected as part of ecosystem activity and are exclusively reserved for token- and ecosystem-related purposes.

allocations.subtitle: 25% of Creator Fees → ACE/SOL Liquidity Pool
purpose: 25% of Creator Fees directly injected into ACE/SOL liquidity pool
Adds real liquidity depth for smoother trading
LP tokens locked to prevent rug pulls
Monthly execution at end of each month
allocations.principle: Real liquidity, not price pumping. We add depth, not buy pressure.
constraints: No market buying to pump price
No short-term price manipulation
Transparent on-chain LP transactions

allocations.subtitle: Including Ecosystem Hiring & Marketing
purpose: Revenue sharing for Nexior ecosystem contributors
Usage-based rebates for templates, workflows, and plugins
Integration incentives strictly tied to shipped and verifiable functionality
Limited-scope grants for real production use cases
Ecosystem-scoped hiring (developers, technical operators, ecosystem support)
Ecosystem-focused marketing (integration announcements, developer outreach, co-marketing with partners)
allocations.principle: Incentives follow measurable usage and contribution, not speculation.
constraints: No generalized brand marketing
No influencer or hype-driven campaigns
All incentives must map to verifiable contribution or adoption metrics

purpose: Capital flexibility
Downside protection
Optionality during adverse or stressed market conditions
allocations.principle: Reserves exist to prevent forced decisions.
constraints: Not earmarked for speculative deployment
Not used to compensate for poor execution elsewhere

purpose: Strategically justified paid token listings
Required technical, legal, compliance, or operational listing costs
One-time external costs that improve token accessibility
allocations.principle: Listings are access infrastructure, not marketing.
constraints: No vanity listings
No pay-for-hype arrangements
No recurring promotional spend disguised as listings

allocations.positioning: Buybacks are a tool, not a commitment. Deprioritized, but not abandoned.
execution_conditions: Platform revenue must be stable and durable
Liquidity depth must already be healthy
Execution may be delayed, paused, or accumulated
constraints: No symbolic or sentiment-driven buybacks
No use as short-term price signaling

platform_revenue.title: Platform Revenue
platform_revenue.description: Platform Revenue reflects real business income generated by Ace Data Cloud and Nexior. It is governed separately from Creator Fees and is used to fund the actual cost structure and execution capacity of the platform.

allocations.note: This is the largest and non-negotiable expense category.
purpose: Procurement of upstream AI, data, and model services
Third-party account, quota, and API costs
Cloud compute, storage, networking, security, and monitoring
Core infrastructure required to operate Nexior reliably
allocations.principle: Platform revenue is cost-first by design.
constraints: These costs are prioritized before any growth or financial actions
No diversion of funds for narrative-driven expansion

allocations.category: Engineering, Product, Hiring, Operations & Distribution Systems
purpose: Nexior core product development and UX
Workflow systems, Dify, and unified gateway reliability
Engineering, product, and platform operations staff
Day-to-day execution and maintenance
Distribution, referral, reseller, and revenue-splitting system development and settlement
Technical, operational, and compliance costs tied to distribution systems
allocations.principle: Distribution is treated as a product capability, not a marketing expense.
constraints: Headcount growth is controlled
Execution-focused, not scale for scale's sake

purpose: Strategic integrations
Enterprise and team onboarding
Nexior-focused distribution partnerships
allocations.principle: Growth follows shipped product, not narrative.
constraints: No speculative expansion
No incentive structures detached from product delivery

allocations.positioning: Optional and low-priority. Executed only when operational stability is assured.
constraints: Not used as a signaling mechanism
May be paused, deferred, or accumulated

purpose: Retained earnings
Risk management
Runway protection
Long-term strategic optionality

items.title: Product and usage come first
items.description: Token mechanisms follow real adoption, not the other way around.

items.title: Capital decisions reduce risk
items.description: Liquidity, runway, and operational stability matter more than short-term signals.

items.title: Clarity over activity
items.description: Shipping clearly is better than doing more.

items.title: Long-term credibility beats short-term attention
items.description: We optimize for trust with builders, partners, and serious stakeholders.

what_building.title: What Ace Is Building
what_building.subtitle: Ace Data Cloud is an AI infrastructure platform powering products through shared accounts, APIs, and billing — serving both enterprises and individuals globally.

cards.title: For Enterprises & Developers
paragraphs: Production-grade API services and infrastructure capabilities for modern AI systems.
bullets: AI Q&A APIs (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Claude, etc.)
AI images (Midjourney, Flux)
AI music (Suno) & videos (Luma, Pika)
HTTP proxies (mobile cellular, residential, global)
Unified AI Gateway with multi-model access and routing

cards.title: For Individuals
paragraphs: A one-stop, user-friendly interface for AI Q&A, images, music, videos, and more — compatible with desktop and mobile.
bullets: Out-of-the-box login (WeChat, Google, GitHub)
Integrated payment and billing
Template-first workflows for high-frequency use cases

cards.title: Core Products
paragraphs: Two core products are tied to Ace accounts and share the same underlying infrastructure.
bullets: Nexior: UI-driven distribution for AI apps, templates, and assets
Dify: Standalone workflow orchestration and logic engine

cards.title: Infrastructure Layers
paragraphs: Four core layers that power everything we build.
bullets: Unified AI Gateway for multi-model access
Workflow orchestration via Dify
Distribution through Nexior templates and apps
Settlement via native payments and billing (including X402)

phases.label: Q1 2026
phases.title: Foundation and Clarity
phases.focus: Reliable delivery, workflow backbone, and disciplined structure

items.title: Continue strengthening the unified AI gateway with improved reliability, routing control, and cost visibility
Finalize and ship Dify as a standalone workflow product with tighter Ace account and API binding
Strengthen core platform flows including onboarding, usage tracking, billing, and value delivery
Improve visibility across the platform so users can clearly see what is live, in progress, or planned
Launch the Ace mobile app on Android and iOS
Focus the app on high-frequency, template-first use cases rather than experimentation
Route app usage directly into workflows and Nexior distribution
Establish workflows as a core orchestration layer through Dify
Enable composable pipelines across model calls, data handling, distribution actions, and billing
Prepare workflow structures for broader standards alignment later in the year
Base X402 payment integration is live
Finalize Solana X402 payment integration within Q1, enabling call-to-pay settlement for additional live use cases
Continue expanding Nexior templates and publishing flows
Prioritize reproducibility and quality over volume
Begin early contributor feedback loops without aggressive incentives
Deprioritize discretionary buybacks at this stage
Focus on liquidity depth, stability, and conservative capital use
Maintain clear separation between platform operations and market-facing mechanisms

phases.label: Q2 2026
phases.title: Adoption and Usage Signals
phases.focus: Lower friction, broader entry points, and visible real usage

items.title: Expand adoption of the mobile app through improved UX, stability, and workflow depth
Increase template-driven usage and real production activity
Strengthen the feedback loop between app usage, workflows, and Nexior distribution
Expand X402-based settlement into more production workflows
Improve receipts, billing transparency, and automated settlement for developers and agents
Roll out structured data services as a real product line
Establish clear standards for ingestion, processing, and delivery
Bind data more tightly into workflows so it becomes part of production pipelines
Land the first wave of practical partnerships
Focus on co-built templates, integrations, and real delivery rather than announcements
Scale routing, fallback strategies, and concurrency support
Improve stability under higher and more complex workloads
Expand workflow modules into more standardized, reusable components
Strengthen Nexior discovery and recommendation so high-quality contributions are easier to find and adopt
Improve contributor earning clarity tied to real usage
Continue careful research into staking and long-term participation models
No rushed deployments
Any pilot remains limited in scope and focused on contribution, not yield
Deliver predictable release cadence
Reduce operational surprises
Position Ace as a dependable platform rather than a toolbox
Push toward a more self-sustaining loop of contributors, distribution, and usage
Reduce reliance on manual curation or intervention
Re-evaluate buybacks only if: platform revenue is meaningfully larger, liquidity depth is already strong, and any buyback activity remains small, non-disruptive, and transparently disclosed
Staking, if expanded, follows data from pilots and prioritizes stability

token_fit.title: How $ACE Fits Into the System
paragraphs: $ACE is designed to strengthen alongside real usage.
bullets: Holding $ACE provides usage-based benefits such as platform fee discounts
Platform usage generates revenue, reinvested into product, hiring, and growth
Trading activity generates creator fees that support liquidity, ecosystem incentives, and reserves
Token mechanisms follow adoption rather than attempting to lead it
The token is not a substitute for product execution

closing.title: Closing
paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud is not optimizing for short-term attention.
bullets: Clear delivery
Real usage
Disciplined capital management
Long-term credibility with builders, partners, and serious stakeholders
closing.final_line: Roadmaps do not create trust. Execution does.
